abstracts.cdata!:
The outcomes of the Second Fiscal
            Restructuring and Deregulation Program Credit Project and
            related Technical Assistance project are mixed but
            satisfactory with likely sustainability and a satisfactory
            performance by both the Bank and the Government. The
            projects demonstrate the synergy between macroeconomic
            stabilization and structural reforms. Also, careful and
            extensive preparation is a necessary but not sufficient
            condition for execution of complex adjustment. Fiscal
            restructuring and civil services reform should begin with a
            fundamental reconsideration of the role of government
            undertake at the political level. While protecting pro-poor
            fiscal outlays may prevent further deterioration of
            services, it cannot address deep-seated problems of equity,
            efficiency, and quality of public health and education The
            willingness of private domestic or foreign enterprises to
            invest in privatized state enterprises in a small poor
            country lacking an established record of good management
            cannot be taken for granted.
